This was Rovers' sixteenth Valentine's Day fixture. The first was a home game with Barrow in 1925.

At first glance, the club's record doesn't look bad.

However, six of those wins game came in Rovers' first eight Valentine's Day fixtures.

The most recent win came in 2004 - when goals from Ryan Taylor and Iain Hume earned a 2-1 win over Swansea City in the FA Cup fifth round. (Click play below to go straight to Hume's screamer. It's worth it.)

Rovers haven't won a league game on Valentine's Day for 47 years\> The last was a 1-0 victory at Brentford in 1976.
